Package fr.isima.codereview.tp1.awesomepasswordchecker

Class AwesomePasswordChecker

java.lang.Object
fr.isima.codereview.tp1.awesomepasswordchecker.AwesomePasswordChecker
public class AwesomePasswordChecker extends Object
This class manages the calculation of password strength. It analyzes the characteristics of a password and returns a strength score It can also calculate the distance between a password and a set of cluster centers.
Version:
2024-11-18
Author:
NDAO Aly

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static AwesomePasswordChecker getInstance(File file) throws IOException
      Returns the singleton instance of the AwesomePasswordChecker, initializing it with the given file. If the instance does not exist, it creates a new one using the provided file to load the necessary data.
      Parameters:
      file - The file containing the necessary data to initialize the AwesomePasswordChecker instance.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of AwesomePasswordChecker.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while reading the file.

    • getInstance

      public static AwesomePasswordChecker getInstance() throws IOException
      Returns the singleton instance of the AwesomePasswordChecker, initializing it with data from a resource file. If the instance does not exist, it creates a new one by loading data from the "cluster_centers_HAC_aff.csv" resource.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of AwesomePasswordChecker.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while reading the resource file.

    • maskAff

      public int[] maskAff(String password)
      Generates a mask array based on the characters in the given password. Each character in the password is mapped to a specific integer value according to predefined rules: - Vowels and some common consonants are mapped to 1 or 3. - Special characters are mapped to 6. - Lowercase letters are mapped to 2, uppercase letters to 4, digits to 5, and other characters to 7. The resulting mask array helps represent the character characteristics of the password.
      Parameters:
      password - The password string for which the mask is generated.
      Returns:
      An integer array of length 28 representing the mask of the password, where each element corresponds to a character in the password. The array will be filled with values based on the character categories defined in the method.

    • getDIstance

      public double getDIstance(String password)
      Calculates the minimum Euclidean distance between the given password and a set of cluster centers. This method generates a mask for the password, then computes the Euclidean distance between the generated mask and each cluster center. It returns the smallest distance found.
      Parameters:
      password - The password for which the distance is calculated.
      Returns:
      The minimum Euclidean distance between the generated mask and the cluster centers.

    • ComputeMD5

      public static String ComputeMD5(String input)
      Computes the MD5 hash of the given input string. This method implements the MD5 algorithm step-by-step, padding the input message, processing it in blocks, and applying the MD5 transformation rounds to generate the hash. The resulting MD5 hash is returned as a 32-character hexadecimal string.
      Parameters:
      input - The input string for which the MD5 hash is computed.
      Returns:
      The 32-character hexadecimal string representing the MD5 hash of the input.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the input is null.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
